| Calculation | If you chose **Calculate** as your **Show** option, select a calculation to reduce each series. For information about available calculations, refer to [Calculation types](ref:calculation-types). | | Limit | If you chose **All values** as your **Show** option, enter a value to limit the number of values displayed. | | Fields | Select which field or fields to display in the visualization. Each field name is available on the list, or you can select one of the following options:
  • **Numeric fields** - All fields with numerical values.
  • **All fields** - All fields that are not removed by transformations.
  • **Time** - All fields with time values.
| +| Sort | Select a sorting direction, or select **None** to have the fields show in the order they are returned from the datasource. |

```suggestion
| Sort | Select a sorting direction, or select **None** to have the fields display in the order in which they're returned from the data source. |
```

discussion_comments.comment_body:
You don't actually need a full URL here since this is just linking to another spot on the same page. This will do the job (and won't require you to make any changes if the pages moves):
```suggestion
The migration assistant currently supports a subset of all resources available in Grafana. Refer to [Supported Resources](#supported-resources) for more details.
```

commented_code:
;header_logo_hide =
 ```
 
-If you specify `footer_hide` to `true`, all the other values are ignored because the footer will not be shown.
+`footer_hide` is no longer available. Set either a `footer_text` or `footer_logo`. Otherwise, the default Grafana footer is displayed.

 ```
 
-If you specify `footer_hide` to `true`, all the other values are ignored because the footer will not be shown.

discussion_comments.comment_body:
I think you should add the `breaking-change` label to this PR and add this as the deprecation notice.

I don't think we should mention a removed option from the documentation so this should be replaced by: 
```
You can set either the `footer_text`, the `footer_logo`, or both. Otherwise, the default Grafana footer is displayed.
```
